description: Demolition of existing buildings and erection of three storey frontage building containing five one-bedroom flats and refuse and recycling storage and part four and five storey building to rear containing five two-bedroom and four one-bedroom flats, formation of pedestrian and vehicular access to service vehicle turning area and two disabled car parking spaces and provision of covered cycle storage, landscaping, gardens, balconies, roof terrace and roof gardens.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.4, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, and details of depth of soil, drainage arrangements and structural calculations in regard to the load bearing capacity of the rooftop, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting  has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON: To ensure that the landscaping is maintained in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Notwithstanding the detail shown on the submitted plans, no development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (including any internal fences, walls and railings to the roof terrace areas) to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the occupation of the units and permanently retained thereafter and no subsequent removal or alteration to the approved boundary treatment shall be carried out without the written consent of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the prospective residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The refuse and recycling storage shown on the approved plans shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding what is shown on the submitted plans, details of balconies shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the prospective residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the installation of any entrance gate to the car parking and servicing area, details of siting and design of an automated gate opening system shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained permanently.  Reason: In the interests of highway safety, and in the interests of living conditions of adjoining occupiers and occupiers of the development hereby permitted, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding what is shown on the submitted plans, details of balustrades and any other privacy measures to the roof top gardens shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the prospective residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers 'Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution' and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, shall be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing. The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to first use of the buildings and be maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the area, in accordance with policy 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The cycle parking shown on the approved plans shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policies 1.9 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking spaces and servicing area and associated access and manoevering areas shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies 4.3, 9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Prior to the first occupation, the redundant crossover to the west of the site on East Acton Lane shall be reinstated to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: In the interests of general highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policy 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development would be affected by traffic noise at a level, which falls into Category C noise exposure.  Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise and vibration, and sensitive rooms from internal building services noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at Document 5.3 "Guidance for developers" produced by the Council's Environmental Health Section.  The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  In addition, further calculations must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in order to the meet the methodology set out in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10.  REASON: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before any development is commenced, to demonstrate that the sound reduction index of the separating party floor/ceiling Rw, would achieve the following criteria with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided:+	The background L90,15min linear noise level in any one third octave band from 50Hz to 160 Hz, and also the overall Linear L90 level, as previously measured inside a habitable room of the nearest affected premises with windows closed, shall not be increased when the amplified music or speech is played and the measurement is repeated at the same position, using L90 linear over any 5 minute period with the background and source operating together.  REASON: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | Prior to the commencement of development the applicant shall submit to the local planning authority for approval a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms of Blocks A and B facing East Acton Lane, the air intake to be sourced at high level from the rear of the blocks, with due care to avoid contamination from extract ventilation and boiler flues  REASON: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | Details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the buildings so that at least 10% of all energy requirements within the resulting development are sourced from renewable energy resources, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the development incorporates energy efficiency measures, in accordance with policy 2.9 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Crime prevention measures shall be implemented to ensure that the requirements of 'Secured By Design' policies are met prior to occupation. These measures shall include an arrangement so that the residents can receive their post, either by arrangement with the Post Office that their employee will be issued with a key to access the gates to the development or by including their letter boxes in the entrance blocks  .REASON: In the interest of the safety of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 4.4 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 'Safer Ealing'. | Residential accommodation shall be constructed to include at least 10% of the units as wheelchair accessible, as shown on the approved plans.  The wheelchair accessible units shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards,  as shown on the approved plans, prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of the contamination, and the approved remedial works shall be implemented before building works commence.  REASON: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until details of protection measures for the two historical boundary pillars and two boundary stones located in Claydon Garden during the construction phase  have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These approved details shall be in place prior to the commencement of any determolition and retained until the development, including the boundary treatment has been completed.  REASON: To ensure that the historical markers are preserved and protected in the public interest in accordance with policies 4.1of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
